item.title: Digitizing analog circuits containing op amps using Wave Digital Filters
item.description: In this post I will share some work I have been doing on Wave Digital Filters, or WDFs for short. WDFs allows one to digitize analog reference circuits in a way that retains the underlying topology, has nice numerical properties, allows for breaking up of annoying delay-free loops when digitizing and has a very nice modular way of dealing with non-linearities. I will not explain the basic WDF theory here but if you are interested the omnipotent paper on the subject written by Fettweis, the creator of WDF, or this tutorial on WDF should get you familiar with the topic.
